page.title: 01MILDENHALL
page.content: {Mildenhall}or{"Minal"}is a quiet village in the valley of the River Kennet.The settlement dates from Roman times.The London to Bath road, the A4, runs just south of Mildenhall. The population is small and there are many old people.It is a mainly agricultural area, used for arable and dairy farms. On the outskirts of Mildenhall at {Stitchcombe}there is a large vineyard, and there is also a trout farm, and strawberry fields.Most of the houses in Mildenhall are built along the main road through the village,though there are a few big houses on top of the valley.Some houses are privately owned,and some are council houses. There is a post office,and a church with a large graveyard.In the centre of the village there is a big village hall,which is now closed as it is unsafe.It is a very pleasant village.
